Articles.Content:
Hey buddies

I'm a pretty good modeler, and I can code well, so I thought I'd try creating something structural for the game.

I'd like to learn how to interact with the user interface as well as create something.

Where do I start? I notice a lot of people making things but where did you get the specs?

Any and all help would be really great.

I use this to get started. Check out dev section for other tutorials and stuff

http://www.alternatewars.com/Games/KSP/Tut1/KSP_Tutorial_1-1.htm

I started this post in the General section. I swear I didn't know this forum existed.

Someone with magic fingers moved me. Thank you. I'll be reading until midnight.

Darn, getting old stinks.

And thank you but I did see that link the other day but I believe it's already obsolete:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/34013-0-20-PartTools-GameDatabase-and-new-features

Edited June 26, 2013 by Gary_P

And thank you but I did see that link the other day but I believe it's already obsolete:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/34013-0-20-PartTools-GameDatabase-and-new-features

No, the part tools are up to date. Getting the game to load a DAE file is the old methods of doing things and is now depeciated.

Sorry, what I meant to say was I think this tutorial is obsolete:

http://www.alternatewars.com/Games/K...torial_1-1.htm

If not them I'll go for it. I set up the game engine but have no idea how to match it with KSP. I built a game in Unity a few years ago when I was taking a course in game design.
